metadata.title: Distinguishing Effects of Cocaine IV and SC on Mesoaccumbens Dopamine and Serotonin Release With Chloral Hydrate Anesthesia

abstract.original_text: BRODERICK, P. A. Distinguishing effects of cocaine IV and SC on mesoaccumbens dopamine and serotonin release with chloral hydrate anesthesia. PHARMACOL BIOCHEM BEHAV 43(3) 929-937, 1992.-The effect of IV cocaine (0.5 and 1.0 mg/kg) was studied on synaptic concentrations of dopamine (DA) and serotonin [5-hydroxytryptamine (5-HT)] in the mesoaccumbens nerve terminal, the nucleus accumbens (NAcc), in chloral hydrate-anesthetized, male Sprague-Dawley rats

sentences.segment_text: BRODERICK , P. A. Distinguishing effects of cocaine IV and SC on mesoaccumbens dopamine and serotonin release with chloral hydrate anesthesia .
1992.-The effect of IV cocaine ( 0.5 and 1.0 mg/kg ) was studied on synaptic concentrations of dopamine ( DA ) and serotonin ( 5-hydroxytryptamine ( 5-HT ) ) in the mesoaccumbens nerve terminal ,
in chloral hydrate-anesthetized , male Sprague-Dawley rats
